alert.note: Alert for South Central Pinal County including Eloy, Picacho Peak State Park; Southeast Pinal County including Kearny, Mammoth, Oracle (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 8:32PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Pinal County through 915 PM MST... At 831 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hayden, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kearny, Dudleyville and Kelvin. This includes the following highways... Route 77 between mile markers 132 and 134. Route 177 between mile markers 139 and 158. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: South Central Pinal County including Eloy, Picacho Peak State Park; Southeast Pinal County including Kearny, Mammoth, Oracle
